intro: Micromeria brownei, commonly known as the California buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Micromeria brownei is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
